columns.text: In this problem, we will apply the concepts learned about reaching the different break-even points and how the cost and other factors affect these points.

**a.** Variable costs are defined as the costs that change depending on the quantity produced as well as the quantity that is being sold by the company. 

In order to solve for the variable cost **per unit**, we can simply add the expenses that are associated with producing the unit. In this case, we will add the materials cost and the labor cost.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{variable cost per unit}&=\$11.13+\$7.29\\[15 pt]
&=\$18.42
\end{aligned}$$

The variable cost per unit is $\$18.42$

**b.** The total costs of a company can be solved by taking the total variable cost as well as the fixed costs.

To get the total variable cost, we can simply multiply the variable cost per unit that was solved in **Step 1**, then multiply it to the number of units produced which is $190,000$.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total variable cost}&=\$18.42\times 190,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$3,499,800.00
\end{aligned}$$

Now that we have the total variable cost, we can simply add in the total fixed costs to get the total costs for the year.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total costs for the year}&=\text{total variable costs}\\
&+\text{total fixed costs}\\[15 pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Adding together the values, we will get:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total costs for the year}
&=\$3,499,800+\$875,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$4,374,800.00
\end{aligned}$$

The total costs for the year is $\$4,374,800.00$

Substituting the known values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=\dfrac{\$875,000}{\$44.99-\$18.42}\\

\end{aligned}$$

Combine the values and divide to get:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=\dfrac{\$875,000}{\$26.57}\\[15 pt]
&=32,931.88\\[15 pt]
&\approx 32,932\ \text{units}
\end{aligned}$$

Based on the computations, the company is above the cash break-even point since they are producing $190,000$ units and the cash break-even point is only at $32,932$ units.

Substituting the values to the formula, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
Q&=\dfrac{\$875,000+\$435,000}{\$44.99-\$18.42}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Combine the values and divide to get:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=\dfrac{\$1,310,000}{\$26.57}\\[15 pt]
&=49,303.73\\[15 pt]
&\approx 49,304\ \text{units}
\end{aligned}$$

The accounting break even point is equal to $49,304$ units.
